intro: Begonia erythrotricha, commonly known as the crimson-hair begonia, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround its small, white flowers, creating an eye-catching display. The plant has velvety, dark green leaves with a prominent midrib and hairy undersides, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
